pullRequest.body:
We change the definition of `RootPairing` so that the induced reflection permutations on roots are required by definition to agree with those on coroots. This rules out pathologies, e.g., for infinite root systems.

---


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks again for doing this.

I've left some initial review (mostly nitpicks) and will follow up with some more (probably tomorrow).

I haven't yet got to my main concern which is ensuring that extensionality lemmas do not lose power during this refactor.
More to follow later.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Now that we have `reflection_perm` available, how about just:
```suggestion
    root j - toLin (root j) (coroot i)  root i = root (reflection_perm i j)
```
(will require downstream fixes)

```suggestion
    coroot j - toLin (root i) (coroot j)  coroot i = coroot (reflection_perm i j)
```
(again, will require downstream fixes)

If we change the definition to drop the `preReflection` according to my suggestion above, then we will have no need for this lemma:
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
    P.root (P.reflection_perm i j) = P.reflection i (P.root j) :=
```

```suggestion
theorem reflection_mapsTo_root : MapsTo (P.reflection i) (range P.root) (range P.root) := by
```

```suggestion
  exact mem_range_self (P.reflection_perm i j)
```

```suggestion
lemma bijOn_reflection_root : BijOn (P.reflection i) (range P.root) (range P.root) :=
  InvOn.bijOn (reflection_invOn_self P i) (P.reflection_mapsTo_root i) (P.reflection_mapsTo_root i)
```

```suggestion
lemma coreflection_invOn_self :
    InvOn (P.coreflection i) (P.coreflection i) (range P.coroot) (range P.coroot) :=
  reflection_invOn_self P.flip i
```

```suggestion
lemma isReduced_iff : P.IsReduced   i j : , i  j 
```

```suggestion
     exact Or.inl (congrArg P.root h')
```

This is just `involutive_preReflection` and can be inlined below
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  apply involutive_preReflection
  exact hp i
```

We shouldn't need the `hp` argument, right?

I think we may need to reorganise slightly so that we don't get a strictly weaker `ext` lemma here.
Yes, that's right.  I will try to fix this.
Okay, I think I got it.
Great, thanks!

What do you think of:
```suggestion
  have : _root_.Finite  := h
  set sxy : M [R] M := (Module.reflection hgy).trans (Module.reflection hfx)
  have hb : BijOn sxy   :=
    (bijOn_reflection_of_mapsTo hfx hxf).comp (bijOn_reflection_of_mapsTo hgy hyg)
  have hsxy :  n : , (sxy^[n]) y = y + (2 * n : )  (x - y) := by
    intro n
    induction n with
    | zero => simp
    | succ n ih =>
      simp only [iterate_succ', comp_apply, ih, zsmul_sub, map_add, LinearEquiv.trans_apply,
        reflection_apply_self, map_neg, reflection_apply, hfy, two_smul, neg_sub, map_sub,
        map_zsmul, hgx, smul_neg, smul_add, Nat.cast_succ, mul_add, mul_one, add_smul, sxy]
      abel
  set f' :    := fun n  (sxy^[n]) y, by
    rw [ IsFixedPt.image_iterate hb.image_eq n]; exact mem_image_of_mem _ hy
  have :  Injective f' := not_injective_infinite_finite f'
  contrapose! this
  intros n m hnm
  rw [Subtype.mk_eq_mk, hsxy, hsxy, add_right_inj,  sub_eq_zero,  sub_smul, smul_eq_zero,
    sub_eq_zero, sub_eq_zero] at hnm
  simpa using hnm.resolve_right this
```
If this would introduce more imports, I suggest putting the API in `Lemmas` in order to keep `Defs` lightweight.

If we use semantic linebreaks, then these diffs would be much smaller and easier to review.

https://sembr.org/

If you like this idea, feel free to switch to semantic linebreaks in a future PR. (No need to change this PR.)
Personally I don't like sembr but of course I've no objection if anyone wants us to use them here.

```suggestion
  P.root.injective h
```
Dropped

```suggestion
  P.root.injective.ne h
```
Not sure if it is worth having these lemmas, given that the proofs are so concise they could be inlined.
I'll leave that up to you.
Agreed, I haven't forgotten this PR belongs to @ScottCarnahan but I hope he won't mind if I make the call to cut these two.

```suggestion
lemma isOrthogonal_comm (h : IsOrthogonal P i j) : Commute (P.reflection i) (P.reflection j) := by
```

I'm not sure this should be `private`. Is `protected` enough?

Because this def is used in other defs that aren't private. So if those are unfolded, users are suddenly faced with a hideous name. Using a private def in the proof of a non-private lemma is fine.

In conclusion, I suggest:
```suggestion
protected def equiv_of_mapsTo :
```
Good point, done.

Adapting to the `protected` above. And fixing some double spaces.
```suggestion
  reflection_perm i := RootPairing.equiv_of_mapsTo p root coroot i hr hp
  reflection_perm_root i j := by
    rw [RootPairing.equiv_of_mapsTo_apply,
      (exist_eq_reflection_of_mapsTo p root coroot i j hr).choose_spec,
      preReflection_apply, LinearMap.flip_apply]
  reflection_perm_coroot i j := by
    refine (coroot_eq_coreflection_of_root_eq' p root coroot hp hr hc ?_).symm
    rw [RootPairing.equiv_of_mapsTo_apply,
      (exist_eq_reflection_of_mapsTo p root coroot i j hr).choose_spec]
```
Thanks, done.

Would it be possible to define this using
```
  [.......] where
  span_eq_top := hsp
  toRootPairing := RootPairing.mk' p root coroot hp hs <| by
    intro i
    sorry
```
or will that sorry be really hard to fill in?
Done.
